main event: On 5 April 1949, numerous civilian witnesses reported seeing a fireball in the sky over Northern Utah, accompanied by explosions and trails of smoke.
interesting points: Reports came from multiple locations including Brigham City, Logan, and Salt Lake City within a 100-mile radius, the explosions were described as sounding like cannon fire or gunshots, Many observers noted seeing a ball of fire descending rapidly, there were observations of both smoke trails and explosive sounds, The incident was associated with military B-29 bombers conducting practice bombing runs in the area.
witness description: Civilians including local residents and employees from various professions.
